text: Olympia is an extinct town in Lowndes County, in the U.S. state of Georgia. ==History== A post office called Olympia was established in 1898, and remained in operation until 1916. The community derives its name from Mount Olympus, in Greece. ==References== Category:Geography of Lowndes County, Georgia Category:Ghost towns in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Olympia, Georgia
